name: lga11_labourforce

keyword: unemployment, labour force participation, female labour force, employment, population, demographic
abstract: Unemployment rates and labour force participation rates (2012) and female labour force participation (Census 2011) by LGA 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: lab_force_1_no_6_12_6_12
selectedAttributes.title: Number of People in the Labour Force - Count
selectedAttributes.description: Number of people in the labour force. Source: Compiled by PHIDU from 1) Small Area Labour Markets - Australia, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations, June Quarter 2012, and 2) ABS Estimated Resident Population, 30 June 2012

selectedAttributes.name: lab_force_2_denom_6_12_6_12
selectedAttributes.title: Population Aged 15 Years and Over
selectedAttributes.description: Population aged 15 years and over. Source: ABS ERP 2012

selectedAttributes.name: lab_force_3_percent_6_12_6_12
selectedAttributes.title: Labour Force Participation - Percentage of Labour Force Participation
selectedAttributes.description: Number of people in the labour force as a percentage of the population aged 15 years and over. i.e. Labour force participation rate. Source: Compiled by PHIDU from 1) Small Area Labour Markets - Australia, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations, June Quarter 2012, and 2) ABS Estimated Resident Population, 30 June 2012

selectedAttributes.title: Number of People Unemployed - Count
selectedAttributes.description: Number of people unemployed. Source: Compiled by PHIDU from Small Area Labour Markets - Australia, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations, June Quarter 2012

selectedAttributes.title: Labour Force
selectedAttributes.description: Total labour force. Source: Compiled by PHIDU from Small Area Labour Markets - Australia, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations, June Quarter 2012

selectedAttributes.name: unemploymnt_3_percent_6_12_6_12
selectedAttributes.title: Unemployment - Percentage of Unemployed
selectedAttributes.description: Number of unemployed as a percentage of the labour force. i.e. Unemployment rate. Source: Compiled by PHIDU from Small Area Labour Markets - Australia, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations, June Quarter 2012
